content: quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: In any case, the government (repub or dem) has something up its sleeves. Stuff is just getting to weird and crazy lately. I am having a very bad feeling about things. I didn't even get this feeling when I was in the Gulf. This feeling is something that has only happened a few times in my life and none of those incidences ended well. Gunny, I am actually a little nervous. You should be your Libertarian status is being questioned and you're being labled as a rightwinger co'z you disagree with the Left on certain issues here. What the memo was meant to do. As we both know and have agreed on, there are many issues in which I disagree with people on the right, as well. But, that would be because I am neither left wing, nor right wing. But, I do support the 2nd, I do support smaller government, I do support states rights and those of the people, I do support sound monetary policy, I do support lower taxation and no taxation on income, etc. These are the things that the left fears from people like myself. I have been called a republican many times in recent days by the liberals on this board because these are the issues in which I side with the republicans. But, it is plainly obvious that I am a Libertarian. I have been very consistent in my views and they are the views that form the basic platform of the Libertarian Party. It seems that the liberals forget that I also support views from the left. I am pro choice, I support legalizing marijuana (all drugs actually), I support the legalization of prostitution, I can care less if gay people want to get married, I support social freedom, I favor diplomacy over military solutions (noninterventionism), I support stem cell research, I do not support trade agreements, I support equal opportunity, I am against torture of any kind, I support people wanting to organize a union (I belong to four unions, myself), etc. But, my support of some of the things from the left does not seem to make up for the things that I support from the right. It is the changing of the tide, really. I was viewed as a liberal when conservatives were in charge. Now that liberals are in charge, I am viewed as a conservative. However, little me has been a Libertarian the whole time. It amazes me how ignorant some people really are. It just further supports my belief that most people truly are idiots. This memo really is irresponsible. It will further divide this country by doing two things. First, it will make the left more antagonistic toward those on the right. They will immediately label them a right wing extremist and as with most liberals, they will be pretty outspoken and blunt about that. The other thing it will do is make the right extremely po'd. And, no matter what political affiliation you have, getting people po'd is not a good idea because they tend to do stupid things when they a mad. So, I imagine that there will be some angry people who actually make themselves fit the description who would have otherwise not fit it before. I see bad things happening in the future. Not just from this report, but from a multitude of things that are happening right now. This is a crazy time and it will only get crazier.
quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: In any case, the government (repub or dem) has something up its sleeves. Stuff is just getting to weird and crazy lately. I am having a very bad feeling about things. I didn't even get this feeling when I was in the Gulf. This feeling is something that has only happened a few times in my life and none of those incidences ended well. Gunny, I am actually a little nervous. You should be your Libertarian status is being questioned and you're being labled as a rightwinger co'z you disagree with the Left on certain issues here. What the memo was meant to do.
reply: As we both know and have agreed on, there are many issues in which I disagree with people on the right, as well. But, that would be because I am neither left wing, nor right wing. But, I do support the 2nd, I do support smaller government, I do support states rights and those of the people, I do support sound monetary policy, I do support lower taxation and no taxation on income, etc. These are the things that the left fears from people like myself. I have been called a republican many times in recent days by the liberals on this board because these are the issues in which I side with the republicans. But, it is plainly obvious that I am a Libertarian. I have been very consistent in my views and they are the views that form the basic platform of the Libertarian Party. It seems that the liberals forget that I also support views from the left. I am pro choice, I support legalizing marijuana (all drugs actually), I support the legalization of prostitution, I can care less if gay people want to get married, I support social freedom, I favor diplomacy over military solutions (noninterventionism), I support stem cell research, I do not support trade agreements, I support equal opportunity, I am against torture of any kind, I support people wanting to organize a union (I belong to four unions, myself), etc. But, my support of some of the things from the left does not seem to make up for the things that I support from the right. It is the changing of the tide, really. I was viewed as a liberal when conservatives were in charge. Now that liberals are in charge, I am viewed as a conservative. However, little me has been a Libertarian the whole time. It amazes me how ignorant some people really are. It just further supports my belief that most people truly are idiots. This memo really is irresponsible. It will further divide this country by doing two things. First, it will make the left more antagonistic toward those on the right. They will immediately label them a right wing extremist and as with most liberals, they will be pretty outspoken and blunt about that. The other thing it will do is make the right extremely po'd. And, no matter what political affiliation you have, getting people po'd is not a good idea because they tend to do stupid things when they a mad. So, I imagine that there will be some angry people who actually make themselves fit the description who would have otherwise not fit it before. I see bad things happening in the future. Not just from this report, but from a multitude of things that are happening right now. This is a crazy time and it will only get crazier.

content: OK, so what if the document originated in 2007?? WE never saw or read the original contents. Who knows what was added in or edited out of the original document?? Even so, we ALL know that GWB wasn't in favor of following the Constitution. It's even worse that the Obama administration is following suit and probably even heightening the prior administration's rhetoric and blatant violations of the Constitution. In Obama's own words, he sees the Constitution as a fundamentally flawed and outdated document..... "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let people have guns ...why should we let them have ideas? --Joseph Stalin"

content: Indeed, Mr. Obama DID IN FACT say he was NOT going to reinstate the so called Assault Weapons Ban. That's a good thing. He REPEATED the false statment that 90% of illegally used guns in Mexico come from the USA, when they do not. 13% or so ORIGINATED in the USA. Repitition of misinformation is bad. BTW, the so called anti-aircraft M G sure looked to me like a 1919 A4 Browning aircooled MG, Usually used in an INFANTRY role. As the newshawks are normally firearms ILLETERATE, they should look this stuff up, get subscriptions to JANE's for goodness gracious! Anyway, the thrust is incorrect here. The object needs to be border enforcement, not the tools, available anywhere on Earth, the cartels use.

content: I often wonder if ppl who keep defending Obama so quickly too. I wonder do they even recognize what direction he has been taken the whole country in? Do they recognize the massive meanings behind many of the changes already made? As they keep blurting out for his defense. Do they actually stop and see that they are affected too?!? It's not about color,race... Religion may be another matter. Are we that defenseless that say me for example. I have the earmarks of being a domestic Terrorist and much insight on many things already going down hill. But is it true, I can't do a dam thing about it? And if I spent 365 days trying to get through to someone that constantly defends the actions of our Gov because Obama is part black and or a democrate, by time the light bulb went off in this persons head, it'll be WAY too late! Times like this I wish I were 97 yrs old and just about to pass away.

content: quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: Yep, I verified it myself and so can you. Download the .PDF file of the DHS report on right-wing extremism and check the properties of the document. You will find that the file was created on 01/23/2007. However, it was modified on 04/12/2009. Who knows what info was put in when? All those dates tell you is that a .PDF file was made on 01/23/2007. The document can easily have existed in another format (eg as a word document) long before that, so it do not really tell us when the document was written.
